p: The autophagy pathway is involved in IAV replication [ 124, 239– 241]. It was suggested that the induction of autophagosome degradation during IAV infections might restrict virus replication within infected cells [ 242]. This could be considered an immune mechanism as well, which impairs or restricts IAV replication and virulence [ 243– 246]. IAV infection inhibited autophagy at the stage of autophagosome/lysosome fusion, which led to the accumulation of autophagosomes in A549 cells [ 124] and evasion of viral antigen presentation [ 124, 247, 248].
